conclusion: Analyze forces on the wire in the magnetic field and use spring scale readings.
Wire ab is suspended in a uniform magnetic field B perpendicular to the paper.
A current I flows from a to b.
Magnetic force on wire is F = I L B, direction determined by right-hand rule.
For current I from a to b and magnetic field into the paper, force is downward.
Spring scale reading F1 includes weight of wire and magnetic force: F1 = mg + I L B.
When current is reversed and doubled to 2I, force direction changes to upward.
Force on wire is F = 2I L B upward.
Spring scale reading F2 includes weight of wire minus magnetic force: F2 = mg - 2I L B.
From first condition: F1 = mg + I L B.
From second condition: F2 = mg - 2I L B.
Subtract second equation from first: F1 - F2 = I L B + 2I L B.
Solve for B: B = (F1 - F2) / (3I L).
